attributes.action: reassure the British people that he will not act upon Tony Blair's advice at the Chilcott enquiry that we should consider repeating his misguided war on Iraq by taking similar miltary action against Iran
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: In the light of Tony Blair's appearance before the Chilcott enquiry and clear evidence there of the misguided nature of the Iraq war, and his continued influential position as Middle East 'peace envoy', and in view of his repeated mention of the possibility of taking similar action against Iran, we believe it is imperative for world security that the Prime Minister and the British government reassure the British people that there will be be no repetition of it in the form of taking similar military action against Iran, whether it be on the pretext of posession of WMDs or for 'regime change', neither of which would be justifiable.

rejection.details: We suggest you read the PM's latest statement on Iran. http://www.number10.gov.uk/Page22450
reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
